intro: Acosta spinosa, commonly known as the spiny acosta, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf shapes and often edible roots. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit, with branched stems covered in stiff, spiny hairs. Its small, clustered flowers are typically greenish-white in color, and it produces small, round berries that are edible. Acosta spinosa thrives in high-altitude environments and is often found in rocky or mountainous terrain.
